intro: Amsinckia turrita, commonly known as the desert sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and other sunflower relatives. The plant is characterized by its yellow, daisy-like flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Amsinckia turrita is adapted to drought conditions and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
